## Exchange Rate Risk

Multinational firms face risks in terms of market performance and value of revenue, given [any degree of exchange rate volatility]{.hp}

<br>

::: {.fragment}
Contracts defined in nominal foreign currency amounts face an [uncertainty]{.hp} regarding how much these costs will scale or deflate reaching a payment date
:::

---

## Exchange Rate Risk

The markets's answer: [Forward Exchange Rates]{.hp}

<br>

> The forward exchange rate sets the price of currency that will be delivered in the future and these transactions take place on the forward market.
[Spot market]{.hp} represents any [buying and selling taking place in the present]{.hp}

---

## Effects of $\Delta$ Supply and $\Delta$ Demand of Foreign Currency

[Let's take the market for GBP]{.h .align-center}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
[Increased Demand]{.hp} for [GBP]{.hi} 

::: {.fragment}
[Raises]{.hi-green} its price 

- It [appreciates]{.hi-green}
:::

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[Increased Supply]{.hp} for [GBP]{.hi}

::: {.fragment}
[Lowers]{.hi-red} its price

- It [depreciates]{.hi-red}
:::

:::

::::

::: {.incremental .small}
- Under a [fixed exchange rate system]{.hp}, values of USD is held constant through actions of the [Central Bank]{.h} that counteract market forces

- Supply and demand analysis is a useful tool for understanding the pressures on a currency regardless of the type of exchange rate system adopted

- We will begin with the [assumption]{.h} that exchange rates are [copmletely flexible]{.hp}
:::

## FX Market: Long Run

In the extreme case, [long-run exchange rates]{.h} should see all [arbitrage]{.hp} eliminated

::: {.fragment}
> This will lead to bids for currencies playing out until the [purchasing power]{.h} of a specific amount of a given [Home Currency]{.h} will be equal to the [purchasing power]{.h} of its foreign currency exchanged when spent abroad
:::

::: {.fragment}
This concept of [equal purchasing power]{.h} internationally for the same basket of goods is called [purchasing power parity (PPP)]{.hp}
:::

::: {.fragment}
> [In the short-run, differences in purchasing power for the same bundle of goods exist]{.note .hi}
:::
